00037 #include <linux/fs.h>
00038 #include <linux/sched.h>
00039 #include <linux/kthread.h>
00040 #include <linux/mm.h>
00041 #include <linux/highmem.h>
00042 #include <linux/pagemap.h>

00044 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LLITE
00045 
00046 #include <obd_support.h>
00047 #include <lustre_dlm.h>
00048 #include "llite_internal.h"
00049 
00050 #define SA_OMITTED_ENTRY_MAX 8ULL
00051 
00052 typedef enum {
00054         SA_ENTRY_INIT = 0,      
00055         SA_ENTRY_SUCC = 1,      
00056         SA_ENTRY_INVA = 2,      
00057 } se_state_t;
00058 
00059 /* sa_entry is not refcounted: statahead thread allocates it and do async stat,
00060  * and in async stat callback ll_statahead_interpret() will add it into
00061  * sai_interim_entries, later statahead thread will call sa_handle_callback() to
00062  * instantiate entry and move it into sai_entries, and then only scanner process
00063  * can access and free it. */
00064 struct sa_entry {
00065         /* link into sai_interim_entries or sai_entries */
00066         struct list_head        se_list;
00067         /* link into sai hash table locally */
00068         struct list_head        se_hash;
00069         /* entry index in the sai */
00070         __u64                   se_index;
00071         /* low layer ldlm lock handle */
00072         __u64                   se_handle;
00073         /* entry status */
00074         se_state_t              se_state;
00075         /* entry size, contains name */
00076         int                     se_size;
00077         /* pointer to async getattr enqueue info */
00078         struct md_enqueue_info *se_minfo;
00079         /* pointer to the async getattr request */
00080         struct ptlrpc_request  *se_req;
00081         /* pointer to the target inode */
00082         struct inode           *se_inode;
00083         /* entry name */
00084         struct qstr             se_qstr;
00085         /* entry fid */
00086         struct lu_fid           se_fid;
00087 };
00088 
00089 static unsigned int sai_generation = 0;
00090 static DEFINE_SPINLOCK(sai_generation_lock);
00091 
00092 static inline int sa_unhashed(struct sa_entry *entry)
00093 {
00094         return list_empty(&entry->se_hash);
00095 }
00096 
00097 /* sa_entry is ready to use */
00098 static inline int sa_ready(struct sa_entry *entry)
00099 {
00100         smp_rmb();
00101         return (entry->se_state != SA_ENTRY_INIT);
00102 }
00103 
00104 /* hash value to put in sai_cache */
00105 static inline int sa_hash(int val)
00106 {
00107         return val & LL_SA_CACHE_MASK;
00108 }
00109 
00110 /* hash entry into sai_cache */
00111 static inline void
00112 sa_rehash(struct ll_statahead_info *sai, struct sa_entry *entry)
00113 {
00114         int i = sa_hash(entry->se_qstr.hash);
00115 
00116         spin_lock(&sai->sai_cache_lock[i]);
00117         list_add_tail(&entry->se_hash, &sai->sai_cache[i]);
00118         spin_unlock(&sai->sai_cache_lock[i]);
00119 }
00120 
00121 /* unhash entry from sai_cache */
00122 static inline void
00123 sa_unhash(struct ll_statahead_info *sai, struct sa_entry *entry)
00124 {
00125         int i = sa_hash(entry->se_qstr.hash);
00126 
00127         spin_lock(&sai->sai_cache_lock[i]);
00128         list_del_init(&entry->se_hash);
00129         spin_unlock(&sai->sai_cache_lock[i]);
00130 }
00131 
00132 static inline int agl_should_run(struct ll_statahead_info *sai,
00133                                  struct inode *inode)
00134 {
00135         return (inode != NULL && S_ISREG(inode->i_mode) && sai->sai_agl_valid);
00136 }
00137 
00138 static inline struct ll_inode_info *
00139 agl_first_entry(struct ll_statahead_info *sai)
00140 {
00141         return list_entry(sai->sai_agls.next, struct ll_inode_info,
00142                           lli_agl_list);
00143 }
00144 
00145 /* statahead window is full */
00146 static inline int sa_sent_full(struct ll_statahead_info *sai)
00147 {
00148         return atomic_read(&sai->sai_cache_count) >= sai->sai_max;
00149 }
00150 
00151 /* got async stat replies */
00152 static inline int sa_has_callback(struct ll_statahead_info *sai)
00153 {
00154         return !list_empty(&sai->sai_interim_entries);
00155 }
00156 
00157 static inline int agl_list_empty(struct ll_statahead_info *sai)
00158 {
00159         return list_empty(&sai->sai_agls);
00160 }
00161 
00168 static inline int sa_low_hit(struct ll_statahead_info *sai)
00169 {
00170         return ((sai->sai_hit > 7 && sai->sai_hit < 4 * sai->sai_miss) ||
00171                 (sai->sai_consecutive_miss > 8));
00172 }
00173 
00174 /*
00175  * if the given index is behind of statahead window more than
00176  * SA_OMITTED_ENTRY_MAX, then it is old.
00177  */
00178 static inline int is_omitted_entry(struct ll_statahead_info *sai, __u64 index)
00179 {
00180         return ((__u64)sai->sai_max + index + SA_OMITTED_ENTRY_MAX <
00181                  sai->sai_index);
00182 }
00183 
00184 /* allocate sa_entry and hash it to allow scanner process to find it */
00185 static struct sa_entry *
00186 sa_alloc(struct ll_statahead_info *sai, __u64 index, const char *name, int len,
00187          const struct lu_fid *fid)
00188 {
00189         struct ll_inode_info *lli;
00190         struct sa_entry *entry;
00191         int entry_size;
00192         char *dname;
00193         ENTRY;
00194 
00195         entry_size = sizeof(struct sa_entry) + (len & ~3) + 4;
00196         OBD_ALLOC(entry, entry_size);
00197         if (unlikely(entry == NULL))
00198                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00199 
00200         CDEBUG(D_READA, "alloc sa entry %.*s(%p) index "LPU64"\n",
00201                len, name, entry, index);
00202 
00203         entry->se_index = index;
00204 
00205         entry->se_state = SA_ENTRY_INIT;
00206         entry->se_size = entry_size;
00207         dname = (char *)entry + sizeof(struct sa_entry);
00208         memcpy(dname, name, len);
00209         dname[len] = 0;
00210         entry->se_qstr.hash = full_name_hash(name, len);
00211         entry->se_qstr.len = len;
00212         entry->se_qstr.name = dname;
00213         entry->se_fid = *fid;
00214 
00215         lli = ll_i2info(sai->sai_dentry->d_inode);
00216 
00217         spin_lock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
00218         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&entry->se_list);
00219         sa_rehash(sai, entry);
00220         spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
00221 
00222         atomic_inc(&sai->sai_cache_count);
00223 
00224         RETURN(entry);
00225 }
00226 
00227 /* free sa_entry, which should have been unhashed and not in any list */
00228 static void sa_free(struct ll_statahead_info *sai, struct sa_entry *entry)
00229 {
00230         CDEBUG(D_READA, "free sa entry %.*s(%p) index "LPU64"\n",
00231                entry->se_qstr.len, entry->se_qstr.name, entry,
00232                entry->se_index);
00233 
00234         LASSERT(list_empty(&entry->se_list));
00235         LASSERT(sa_unhashed(entry));
00236 
00237         OBD_FREE(entry, entry->se_size);
00238         atomic_dec(&sai->sai_cache_count);
00239 }
00240 
00241 /*
00242  * find sa_entry by name, used by directory scanner, lock is not needed because
00243  * only scanner can remove the entry from cache.
00244  */
00245 static struct sa_entry *
00246 sa_get(struct ll_statahead_info *sai, const struct qstr *qstr)
00247 {
00248         struct sa_entry *entry;
00249         int i = sa_hash(qstr->hash);
00250 
00251         list_for_each_entry(entry, &sai->sai_cache[i], se_hash) {
00252                 if (entry->se_qstr.hash == qstr->hash &&
00253                     entry->se_qstr.len == qstr->len &&
00254                     memcmp(entry->se_qstr.name, qstr->name, qstr->len) == 0)
00255                         return entry;
00256         }
00257         return NULL;
00258 }
00259 
00260 /* unhash and unlink sa_entry, and then free it */
00261 static inline void
00262 sa_kill(struct ll_statahead_info *sai, struct sa_entry *entry)
00263 {
00264         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(sai->sai_dentry->d_inode);
00265 
00266         LASSERT(!sa_unhashed(entry));
00267         LASSERT(!list_empty(&entry->se_list));
00268         LASSERT(sa_ready(entry));
00269 
00270         sa_unhash(sai, entry);
00271 
00272         spin_lock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
00273         list_del_init(&entry->se_list);
00274         spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
00275 
00276         if (entry->se_inode != NULL)
00277                 iput(entry->se_inode);
00278 
00279         sa_free(sai, entry);
00280 }
00281 
00282 /* called by scanner after use, sa_entry will be killed */
00283 static void
00284 sa_put(struct ll_statahead_info *sai, struct sa_entry *entry)
00285 {
00286         struct sa_entry *tmp, *next;
00287 
00288         if (entry != NULL && entry->se_state == SA_ENTRY_SUCC) {
00289                 struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(sai->sai_dentry->d_inode);
00290 
00291                 sai->sai_hit++;
00292                 sai->sai_consecutive_miss = 0;
00293                 sai->sai_max = min(2 * sai->sai_max, sbi->ll_sa_max);
00294         } else {
00295                 sai->sai_miss++;
00296                 sai->sai_consecutive_miss++;
00297         }
00298 
00299         if (entry != NULL)
00300                 sa_kill(sai, entry);
00301 
00302         /* kill old completed entries, only scanner process does this, no need
00303          * to lock */
00304         list_for_each_entry_safe(tmp, next, &sai->sai_entries, se_list) {
00305                 if (!is_omitted_entry(sai, tmp->se_index))
00306                         break;
00307                 sa_kill(sai, tmp);
00308         }
00309 
00310         wake_up(&sai->sai_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00311 }
00312 
00313 /* update state and sort add entry to sai_entries by index, return true if
00314  * scanner is waiting on this entry. */
00315 static bool
00316 __sa_make_ready(struct ll_statahead_info *sai, struct sa_entry *entry, int ret)
00317 {
00318         struct sa_entry *se;
00319         struct list_head *pos = &sai->sai_entries;
00320         __u64 index = entry->se_index;
00321 
00322         LASSERT(!sa_ready(entry));
00323         LASSERT(list_empty(&entry->se_list));
00324 
00325         list_for_each_entry_reverse(se, &sai->sai_entries, se_list) {
00326                 if (se->se_index < entry->se_index) {
00327                         pos = &se->se_list;
00328                         break;
00329                 }
00330         }
00331         list_add(&entry->se_list, pos);
00332         entry->se_state = ret < 0 ? SA_ENTRY_INVA : SA_ENTRY_SUCC;
00333 
00334         return (index == sai->sai_index_wait);
00335 }
00336 
00337 /*
00338  * release resources used in async stat RPC, update entry state and wakeup if
00339  * scanner process it waiting on this entry.
00340  */
00341 static void
00342 sa_make_ready(struct ll_statahead_info *sai, struct sa_entry *entry, int ret)
00343 {
00344         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(sai->sai_dentry->d_inode);
00345         struct md_enqueue_info *minfo = entry->se_minfo;
00346         struct ptlrpc_request *req = entry->se_req;
00347         bool wakeup;
00348 
00349         /* release resources used in RPC */
00350         if (minfo) {
00351                 entry->se_minfo = NULL;
00352                 ll_intent_release(&minfo->mi_it);
00353                 iput(minfo->mi_dir);
00354                 OBD_FREE_PTR(minfo);
00355         }
00356 
00357         if (req) {
00358                 entry->se_req = NULL;
00359                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00360         }
00361 
00362         spin_lock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
00363         wakeup = __sa_make_ready(sai, entry, ret);
00364         spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
00365 
00366         if (wakeup)
00367                 wake_up(&sai->sai_waitq);
00368 }
00369 
00370 /* insert inode into the list of sai_agls */
00371 static void ll_agl_add(struct ll_statahead_info *sai,
00372                        struct inode *inode, int index)
00373 {
00374         struct ll_inode_info *child  = ll_i2info(inode);
00375         struct ll_inode_info *parent = ll_i2info(sai->sai_dentry->d_inode);
00376         int                   added  = 0;
00377 
00378         spin_lock(&child->lli_agl_lock);
00379         if (child->lli_agl_index == 0) {
00380                 child->lli_agl_index = index;
00381                 spin_unlock(&child->lli_agl_lock);
00382 
00383                 LASSERT(list_empty(&child->lli_agl_list));
00384 
00385                 igrab(inode);
00386                 spin_lock(&parent->lli_agl_lock);
00387                 if (agl_list_empty(sai))
00388                         added = 1;
00389                 list_add_tail(&child->lli_agl_list, &sai->sai_agls);
00390                 spin_unlock(&parent->lli_agl_lock);
00391         } else {
00392                 spin_unlock(&child->lli_agl_lock);
00393         }
00394 
00395         if (added > 0)
00396                 wake_up(&sai->sai_agl_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00397 }
00398 
00399 /* allocate sai */
00400 static struct ll_statahead_info *ll_sai_alloc(struct dentry *dentry)
00401 {
00402         struct ll_statahead_info *sai;
00403         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(dentry->d_inode);
00404         int i;
00405         ENTRY;
00406 
00407         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(sai);
00408         if (!sai)
00409                 RETURN(NULL);
00410 
00411         sai->sai_dentry = dget(dentry);
00412         atomic_set(&sai->sai_refcount, 1);
00413         sai->sai_max = LL_SA_RPC_MIN;
00414         sai->sai_index = 1;
00415         init_waitqueue_head(&sai->sai_waitq);
00416         init_waitqueue_head(&sai->sai_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00417         init_waitqueue_head(&sai->sai_agl_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00418 
00419         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sai->sai_interim_entries);
00420         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sai->sai_entries);
00421         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sai->sai_agls);
00422 
00423         for (i = 0; i < LL_SA_CACHE_SIZE; i++) {
00424                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sai->sai_cache[i]);
00425                 spin_lock_init(&sai->sai_cache_lock[i]);
00426         }
00427         atomic_set(&sai->sai_cache_count, 0);
00428 
00429         spin_lock(&sai_generation_lock);
00430         lli->lli_sa_generation = ++sai_generation;
00431         if (unlikely(sai_generation == 0))
00432                 lli->lli_sa_generation = ++sai_generation;
00433         spin_unlock(&sai_generation_lock);
00434 
00435         RETURN(sai);
00436 }
00437 
00438 /* free sai */
00439 static inline void ll_sai_free(struct ll_statahead_info *sai)
00440 {
00441         LASSERT(sai->sai_dentry != NULL);
00442         dput(sai->sai_dentry);
00443         OBD_FREE_PTR(sai);
00444 }
00445 
00446 /*
00447  * take refcount of sai if sai for @dir exists, which means statahead is on for
00448  * this directory.
00449  */
00450 static inline struct ll_statahead_info *ll_sai_get(struct inode *dir)
00451 {
00452         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(dir);
00453         struct ll_statahead_info *sai = NULL;
00454 
00455         spin_lock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
00456         sai = lli->lli_sai;
00457         if (sai != NULL)
00458                 atomic_inc(&sai->sai_refcount);
00459         spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
00460 
00461         return sai;
00462 }
00463 
00464 /*
00465  * put sai refcount after use, if refcount reaches zero, free sai and sa_entries
00466  * attached to it.
00467  */
00468 static void ll_sai_put(struct ll_statahead_info *sai)
00469 {
00470         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(sai->sai_dentry->d_inode);
00471 
00472         if (atomic_dec_and_lock(&sai->sai_refcount, &lli->lli_sa_lock)) {
00473                 struct sa_entry *entry, *next;
00474                 struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(sai->sai_dentry->d_inode);
00475 
00476                 lli->lli_sai = NULL;
00477                 spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
00478 
00479                 LASSERT(thread_is_stopped(&sai->sai_thread));
00480                 LASSERT(thread_is_stopped(&sai->sai_agl_thread));
00481                 LASSERT(sai->sai_sent == sai->sai_replied);
00482                 LASSERT(!sa_has_callback(sai));
00483 
00484                 list_for_each_entry_safe(entry, next, &sai->sai_entries,
00485                                          se_list)
00486                         sa_kill(sai, entry);
00487 
00488                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&sai->sai_cache_count) == 0);
00489                 LASSERT(agl_list_empty(sai));
00490 
00491                 ll_sai_free(sai);
00492                 atomic_dec(&sbi->ll_sa_running);
00493         }
00494 }
00495 
00496 /* Do NOT forget to drop inode refcount when into sai_agls. */
00497 static void ll_agl_trigger(struct inode *inode, struct ll_statahead_info *sai)
00498 {
00499         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(inode);
00500         __u64 index = lli->lli_agl_index;
00501         int rc;
00502         ENTRY;
00503 
00504         LASSERT(list_empty(&lli->lli_agl_list));
00505 
00506         /* AGL maybe fall behind statahead with one entry */
00507         if (is_omitted_entry(sai, index + 1)) {
00508                 lli->lli_agl_index = 0;
00509                 iput(inode);
00510                 RETURN_EXIT;
00511         }
00512 
00513         /* Someone is in glimpse (sync or async), do nothing. */
00514         rc = down_write_trylock(&lli->lli_glimpse_sem);
00515         if (rc == 0) {
00516                 lli->lli_agl_index = 0;
00517                 iput(inode);
00518                 RETURN_EXIT;
00519         }
00520 
00521         /*
00522          * Someone triggered glimpse within 1 sec before.
00523          * 1) The former glimpse succeeded with glimpse lock granted by OST, and
00524          *    if the lock is still cached on client, AGL needs to do nothing. If
00525          *    it is cancelled by other client, AGL maybe cannot obtaion new lock
00526          *    for no glimpse callback triggered by AGL.
00527          * 2) The former glimpse succeeded, but OST did not grant glimpse lock.
00528          *    Under such case, it is quite possible that the OST will not grant
00529          *    glimpse lock for AGL also.
00530          * 3) The former glimpse failed, compared with other two cases, it is
00531          *    relative rare. AGL can ignore such case, and it will not muchly
00532          *    affect the performance.
00533          */
00534         if (lli->lli_glimpse_time != 0 &&
00535             cfs_time_before(cfs_time_shift(-1), lli->lli_glimpse_time)) {
00536                 up_write(&lli->lli_glimpse_sem);
00537                 lli->lli_agl_index = 0;
00538                 iput(inode);
00539                 RETURN_EXIT;
00540         }
00541 
00542         CDEBUG(D_READA, "Handling (init) async glimpse: inode = "
00543                DFID", idx = "LPU64"\n", PFID(&lli->lli_fid), index);
00544 
00545         cl_agl(inode);
00546         lli->lli_agl_index = 0;
00547         lli->lli_glimpse_time = cfs_time_current();
00548         up_write(&lli->lli_glimpse_sem);
00549 
00550         CDEBUG(D_READA, "Handled (init) async glimpse: inode= "
00551                DFID", idx = "LPU64", rc = %d\n",
00552                PFID(&lli->lli_fid), index, rc);
00553 
00554         iput(inode);
00555 
00556         EXIT;
00557 }
00558 
00559 /*
00560  * prepare inode for sa entry, add it into agl list, now sa_entry is ready
00561  * to be used by scanner process.
00562  */
00563 static void sa_instantiate(struct ll_statahead_info *sai,
00564                                  struct sa_entry *entry)
00565 {
00566         struct inode *dir = sai->sai_dentry->d_inode;
00567         struct inode *child;
00568         struct md_enqueue_info *minfo;
00569         struct lookup_intent *it;
00570         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00571         struct mdt_body *body;
00572         int rc = 0;
00573         ENTRY;
00574 
00575         LASSERT(entry->se_handle != 0);
00576 
00577         minfo = entry->se_minfo;
00578         it = &minfo->mi_it;
00579         req = entry->se_req;
00580         body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY);
00581         if (body == NULL)
00582                 GOTO(out, rc = -EFAULT);
00583 
00584         child = entry->se_inode;
00585         if (child != NULL) {
00586                 /* revalidate; unlinked and re-created with the same name */
00587                 if (unlikely(!lu_fid_eq(&minfo->mi_data.op_fid2,
00588                                         &body->mbo_fid1))) {
00589                         entry->se_inode = NULL;
00590                         iput(child);
00591                         child = NULL;
00592                 }
00593         }
00594 
00595         it->it_lock_handle = entry->se_handle;
00596         rc = md_revalidate_lock(ll_i2mdexp(dir), it, ll_inode2fid(dir), NULL);
00597         if (rc != 1)
00598                 GOTO(out, rc = -EAGAIN);
00599 
00600         rc = ll_prep_inode(&child, req, dir->i_sb, it);
00601         if (rc)
00602                 GOTO(out, rc);
00603 
00604         CDEBUG(D_READA, "%s: setting %.*s"DFID" l_data to inode %p\n",
00605                ll_get_fsname(child->i_sb, NULL, 0),
00606                entry->se_qstr.len, entry->se_qstr.name,
00607                PFID(ll_inode2fid(child)), child);
00608         ll_set_lock_data(ll_i2sbi(dir)->ll_md_exp, child, it, NULL);
00609 
00610         entry->se_inode = child;
00611 
00612         if (agl_should_run(sai, child))
00613                 ll_agl_add(sai, child, entry->se_index);
00614 
00615         EXIT;
00616 
00617 out:
00618         /* sa_make_ready() will drop ldlm ibits lock refcount by calling
00619          * ll_intent_drop_lock() in spite of failures. Do not worry about
00620          * calling ll_intent_drop_lock() more than once. */
00621         sa_make_ready(sai, entry, rc);
00622 }
00623 
00624 /* once there are async stat replies, instantiate sa_entry from replies */
00625 static void sa_handle_callback(struct ll_statahead_info *sai)
00626 {
00627         struct ll_inode_info *lli;
00628 
00629         lli = ll_i2info(sai->sai_dentry->d_inode);
00630 
00631         while (sa_has_callback(sai)) {
00632                 struct sa_entry *entry;
00633 
00634                 spin_lock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
00635                 if (unlikely(!sa_has_callback(sai))) {
00636                         spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
00637                         break;
00638                 }
00639                 entry = list_entry(sai->sai_interim_entries.next,
00640                                    struct sa_entry, se_list);
00641                 list_del_init(&entry->se_list);
00642                 spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
00643 
00644                 sa_instantiate(sai, entry);
00645         }
00646 }
00647 
00648 /*
00649  * callback for async stat RPC, because this is called in ptlrpcd context, we
00650  * only put sa_entry in sai_interim_entries, and wake up statahead thread to
00651  * really prepare inode and instantiate sa_entry later.
00652  */
00653 static int ll_statahead_interpret(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00654                                   struct md_enqueue_info *minfo, int rc)
00655 {
00656         struct lookup_intent *it = &minfo->mi_it;
00657         struct inode *dir = minfo->mi_dir;
00658         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(dir);
00659         struct ll_statahead_info *sai = lli->lli_sai;
00660         struct sa_entry *entry = (struct sa_entry *)minfo->mi_cbdata;
00661         __u64 handle = 0;
00662         wait_queue_head_t *waitq = NULL;
00663         ENTRY;
00664 
00665         if (it_disposition(it, DISP_LOOKUP_NEG))
00666                 rc = -ENOENT;
00667 
00668         /* because statahead thread will wait for all inflight RPC to finish,
00669          * sai should be always valid, no need to refcount */
00670         LASSERT(sai != NULL);
00671         LASSERT(!thread_is_stopped(&sai->sai_thread));
00672         LASSERT(entry != NULL);
00673 
00674         CDEBUG(D_READA, "sa_entry %.*s rc %d\n",
00675                entry->se_qstr.len, entry->se_qstr.name, rc);
00676 
00677         if (rc != 0) {
00678                 ll_intent_release(it);
00679                 iput(dir);
00680                 OBD_FREE_PTR(minfo);
00681         } else {
00682                 /* release ibits lock ASAP to avoid deadlock when statahead
00683                  * thread enqueues lock on parent in readdir and another
00684                  * process enqueues lock on child with parent lock held, eg.
00685                  * unlink. */
00686                 handle = it->it_lock_handle;
00687                 ll_intent_drop_lock(it);
00688         }
00689 
00690         spin_lock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
00691         if (rc != 0) {
00692                 if (__sa_make_ready(sai, entry, rc))
00693                         waitq = &sai->sai_waitq;
00694         } else {
00695                 entry->se_minfo = minfo;
00696                 entry->se_req = ptlrpc_request_addref(req);
00697                 /* Release the async ibits lock ASAP to avoid deadlock
00698                  * when statahead thread tries to enqueue lock on parent
00699                  * for readpage and other tries to enqueue lock on child
00700                  * with parent's lock held, for example: unlink. */
00701                 entry->se_handle = handle;
00702                 if (!sa_has_callback(sai))
00703                         waitq = &sai->sai_thread.t_ctl_waitq;
00704 
00705                 list_add_tail(&entry->se_list, &sai->sai_interim_entries);
00706         }
00707         sai->sai_replied++;
00708         if (waitq != NULL)
00709                 wake_up(waitq);
00710         spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
00711 
00712         RETURN(rc);
00713 }
00714 
00715 /* finish async stat RPC arguments */
00716 static void sa_fini_data(struct md_enqueue_info *minfo)
00717 {
00718         iput(minfo->mi_dir);
00719         OBD_FREE_PTR(minfo);
00720 }
00721 
00722 /*
00723  * prepare arguments for async stat RPC.
00724  */
00725 static struct md_enqueue_info *
00726 sa_prep_data(struct inode *dir, struct inode *child, struct sa_entry *entry)
00727 {
00728         struct md_enqueue_info   *minfo;
00729         struct ldlm_enqueue_info *einfo;
00730         struct md_op_data        *op_data;
00731 
00732         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(minfo);
00733         if (minfo == NULL)
00734                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
00735 
00736         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(&minfo->mi_data, dir, child, NULL, 0, 0,
00737                                      LUSTRE_OPC_ANY, NULL);
00738         if (IS_ERR(op_data)) {
00739                 OBD_FREE_PTR(minfo);
00740                 return (struct md_enqueue_info *)op_data;
00741         }
00742 
00743         if (child == NULL)
00744                 op_data->op_fid2 = entry->se_fid;
00745 
00746         minfo->mi_it.it_op = IT_GETATTR;
00747         minfo->mi_dir = igrab(dir);
00748         minfo->mi_cb = ll_statahead_interpret;
00749         minfo->mi_cbdata = entry;
00750 
00751         einfo = &minfo->mi_einfo;
00752         einfo->ei_type   = LDLM_IBITS;
00753         einfo->ei_mode   = it_to_lock_mode(&minfo->mi_it);
00754         einfo->ei_cb_bl  = ll_md_blocking_ast;
00755         einfo->ei_cb_cp  = ldlm_completion_ast;
00756         einfo->ei_cb_gl  = NULL;
00757         einfo->ei_cbdata = NULL;
00758 
00759         return minfo;
00760 }
00761 
00762 /* async stat for file not found in dcache */
00763 static int sa_lookup(struct inode *dir, struct sa_entry *entry)
00764 {
00765         struct md_enqueue_info   *minfo;
00766         int                       rc;
00767         ENTRY;
00768 
00769         minfo = sa_prep_data(dir, NULL, entry);
00770         if (IS_ERR(minfo))
00771                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(minfo));
00772 
00773         rc = md_intent_getattr_async(ll_i2mdexp(dir), minfo);
00774         if (rc < 0)
00775                 sa_fini_data(minfo);
00776 
00777         RETURN(rc);
00778 }
00779 
00787 static int sa_revalidate(struct inode *dir, struct sa_entry *entry,
00788                          struct dentry *dentry)
00789 {
00790         struct inode *inode = dentry->d_inode;
00791         struct lookup_intent it = { .it_op = IT_GETATTR,
00792                                     .it_lock_handle = 0 };
00793         struct md_enqueue_info *minfo;
00794         int rc;
00795         ENTRY;
00796 
00797         if (unlikely(inode == NULL))
00798                 RETURN(1);
00799 
00800         if (d_mountpoint(dentry))
00801                 RETURN(1);
00802 
00803         entry->se_inode = igrab(inode);
00804         rc = md_revalidate_lock(ll_i2mdexp(dir), &it, ll_inode2fid(inode),
00805                                 NULL);
00806         if (rc == 1) {
00807                 entry->se_handle = it.it_lock_handle;
00808                 ll_intent_release(&it);
00809                 RETURN(1);
00810         }
00811 
00812         minfo = sa_prep_data(dir, inode, entry);
00813         if (IS_ERR(minfo)) {
00814                 entry->se_inode = NULL;
00815                 iput(inode);
00816                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(minfo));
00817         }
00818 
00819         rc = md_intent_getattr_async(ll_i2mdexp(dir), minfo);
00820         if (rc < 0) {
00821                 entry->se_inode = NULL;
00822                 iput(inode);
00823                 sa_fini_data(minfo);
00824         }
00825 
00826         RETURN(rc);
00827 }
00828 
00829 /* async stat for file with @name */
00830 static void sa_statahead(struct dentry *parent, const char *name, int len,
00831                          const struct lu_fid *fid)
00832 {
00833         struct inode *dir = parent->d_inode;
00834         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(dir);
00835         struct ll_statahead_info *sai = lli->lli_sai;
00836         struct dentry *dentry = NULL;
00837         struct sa_entry *entry;
00838         int rc;
00839         ENTRY;
00840 
00841         entry = sa_alloc(sai, sai->sai_index, name, len, fid);
00842         if (IS_ERR(entry))
00843                 RETURN_EXIT;
00844 
00845         dentry = d_lookup(parent, &entry->se_qstr);
00846         if (!dentry) {
00847                 rc = sa_lookup(dir, entry);
00848         } else {
00849                 rc = sa_revalidate(dir, entry, dentry);
00850                 if (rc == 1 && agl_should_run(sai, dentry->d_inode))
00851                         ll_agl_add(sai, dentry->d_inode, entry->se_index);
00852         }
00853 
00854         if (dentry != NULL)
00855                 dput(dentry);
00856 
00857         if (rc != 0)
00858                 sa_make_ready(sai, entry, rc);
00859         else
00860                 sai->sai_sent++;
00861 
00862         sai->sai_index++;
00863 
00864         EXIT;
00865 }
00866 
00867 /* async glimpse (agl) thread main function */
00868 static int ll_agl_thread(void *arg)
00869 {
00870         struct dentry *parent = (struct dentry *)arg;
00871         struct inode *dir = parent->d_inode;
00872         struct ll_inode_info *plli = ll_i2info(dir);
00873         struct ll_inode_info *clli;
00874         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(dir);
00875         struct ll_statahead_info *sai;
00876         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread;
00877         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
00878         ENTRY;
00879 
00880 
00881         sai = ll_sai_get(dir);
00882         thread = &sai->sai_agl_thread;
00883         thread->t_pid = current_pid();
00884         CDEBUG(D_READA, "agl thread started: sai %p, parent %.*s\n",
00885                sai, parent->d_name.len, parent->d_name.name);
00886 
00887         atomic_inc(&sbi->ll_agl_total);
00888         spin_lock(&plli->lli_agl_lock);
00889         sai->sai_agl_valid = 1;
00890         if (thread_is_init(thread))
00891                 /* If someone else has changed the thread state
00892                  * (e.g. already changed to SVC_STOPPING), we can't just
00893                  * blindly overwrite that setting. */
00894                 thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_RUNNING);
00895         spin_unlock(&plli->lli_agl_lock);
00896         wake_up(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
00897 
00898         while (1) {
00899                 l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
00900                              !agl_list_empty(sai) ||
00901                              !thread_is_running(thread),
00902                              &lwi);
00903 
00904                 if (!thread_is_running(thread))
00905                         break;
00906 
00907                 spin_lock(&plli->lli_agl_lock);
00908                 /* The statahead thread maybe help to process AGL entries,
00909                  * so check whether list empty again. */
00910                 if (!agl_list_empty(sai)) {
00911                         clli = agl_first_entry(sai);
00912                         list_del_init(&clli->lli_agl_list);
00913                         spin_unlock(&plli->lli_agl_lock);
00914                         ll_agl_trigger(&clli->lli_vfs_inode, sai);
00915                 } else {
00916                         spin_unlock(&plli->lli_agl_lock);
00917                 }
00918         }
00919 
00920         spin_lock(&plli->lli_agl_lock);
00921         sai->sai_agl_valid = 0;
00922         while (!agl_list_empty(sai)) {
00923                 clli = agl_first_entry(sai);
00924                 list_del_init(&clli->lli_agl_list);
00925                 spin_unlock(&plli->lli_agl_lock);
00926                 clli->lli_agl_index = 0;
00927                 iput(&clli->lli_vfs_inode);
00928                 spin_lock(&plli->lli_agl_lock);
00929         }
00930         thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_STOPPED);
00931         spin_unlock(&plli->lli_agl_lock);
00932         wake_up(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
00933         ll_sai_put(sai);
00934         CDEBUG(D_READA, "agl thread stopped: sai %p, parent %.*s\n",
00935                sai, parent->d_name.len, parent->d_name.name);
00936         RETURN(0);
00937 }
00938 
00939 /* start agl thread */
00940 static void ll_start_agl(struct dentry *parent, struct ll_statahead_info *sai)
00941 {
00942         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread = &sai->sai_agl_thread;
00943         struct l_wait_info    lwi    = { 0 };
00944         struct ll_inode_info  *plli;
00945         struct task_struct            *task;
00946         ENTRY;
00947 
00948         CDEBUG(D_READA, "start agl thread: sai %p, parent %.*s\n",
00949                sai, parent->d_name.len, parent->d_name.name);
00950 
00951         plli = ll_i2info(parent->d_inode);
00952         task = kthread_run(ll_agl_thread, parent,
00953                                "ll_agl_%u", plli->lli_opendir_pid);
00954         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
00955                 CERROR("can't start ll_agl thread, rc: %ld\n", PTR_ERR(task));
00956                 thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_STOPPED);
00957                 RETURN_EXIT;
00958         }
00959 
00960         l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
00961                      thread_is_running(thread) || thread_is_stopped(thread),
00962                      &lwi);
00963         EXIT;
00964 }
00965 
00966 /* statahead thread main function */
00967 static int ll_statahead_thread(void *arg)
00968 {
00969         struct dentry *parent = (struct dentry *)arg;
00970         struct inode *dir = parent->d_inode;
00971         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(dir);
00972         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(dir);
00973         struct ll_statahead_info *sai;
00974         struct ptlrpc_thread *sa_thread;
00975         struct ptlrpc_thread *agl_thread;
00976         int first = 0;
00977         struct md_op_data *op_data;
00978         struct ll_dir_chain chain;
00979         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
00980         struct page *page = NULL;
00981         __u64 pos = 0;
00982         int rc = 0;
00983         ENTRY;
00984 
00985         sai = ll_sai_get(dir);
00986         sa_thread = &sai->sai_thread;
00987         agl_thread = &sai->sai_agl_thread;
00988         sa_thread->t_pid = current_pid();
00989         CDEBUG(D_READA, "statahead thread starting: sai %p, parent %.*s\n",
00990                sai, parent->d_name.len, parent->d_name.name);
00991 
00992         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, dir, dir, NULL, 0, 0,
00993                                      LUSTRE_OPC_ANY, dir);
00994         if (IS_ERR(op_data))
00995                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(op_data));
00996 
00997         op_data->op_max_pages = ll_i2sbi(dir)->ll_md_brw_pages;
00998 
00999         if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_AGL_ENABLED)
01000                 ll_start_agl(parent, sai);
01001 
01002         atomic_inc(&sbi->ll_sa_total);
01003         spin_lock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01004         if (thread_is_init(sa_thread))
01005                 /* If someone else has changed the thread state
01006                  * (e.g. already changed to SVC_STOPPING), we can't just
01007                  * blindly overwrite that setting. */
01008                 thread_set_flags(sa_thread, SVC_RUNNING);
01009         spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01010         wake_up(&sa_thread->t_ctl_waitq);
01011 
01012         ll_dir_chain_init(&chain);
01013         while (pos != MDS_DIR_END_OFF && thread_is_running(sa_thread)) {
01014                 struct lu_dirpage *dp;
01015                 struct lu_dirent  *ent;
01016 
01017                 sai->sai_in_readpage = 1;
01018                 page = ll_get_dir_page(dir, op_data, pos, &chain);
01019                 sai->sai_in_readpage = 0;
01020                 if (IS_ERR(page)) {
01021                         rc = PTR_ERR(page);
01022                         CDEBUG(D_READA, "error reading dir "DFID" at "LPU64
01023                                "/"LPU64" opendir_pid = %u: rc = %d\n",
01024                                PFID(ll_inode2fid(dir)), pos, sai->sai_index,
01025                                lli->lli_opendir_pid, rc);
01026                         break;
01027                 }
01028 
01029                 dp = page_address(page);
01030                 for (ent = lu_dirent_start(dp);
01031                      ent != NULL && thread_is_running(sa_thread) &&
01032                      !sa_low_hit(sai);
01033                      ent = lu_dirent_next(ent)) {
01034                         __u64 hash;
01035                         int namelen;
01036                         char *name;
01037                         struct lu_fid fid;
01038 
01039                         hash = le64_to_cpu(ent->lde_hash);
01040                         if (unlikely(hash < pos))
01041                                 /*
01042                                  * Skip until we find target hash value.
01043                                  */
01044                                 continue;
01045 
01046                         namelen = le16_to_cpu(ent->lde_namelen);
01047                         if (unlikely(namelen == 0))
01048                                 /*
01049                                  * Skip dummy record.
01050                                  */
01051                                 continue;
01052 
01053                         name = ent->lde_name;
01054                         if (name[0] == '.') {
01055                                 if (namelen == 1) {
01056                                         /*
01057                                          * skip "."
01058                                          */
01059                                         continue;
01060                                 } else if (name[1] == '.' && namelen == 2) {
01061                                         /*
01062                                          * skip ".."
01063                                          */
01064                                         continue;
01065                                 } else if (!sai->sai_ls_all) {
01066                                         /*
01067                                          * skip hidden files.
01068                                          */
01069                                         sai->sai_skip_hidden++;
01070                                         continue;
01071                                 }
01072                         }
01073 
01074                         /*
01075                          * don't stat-ahead first entry.
01076                          */
01077                         if (unlikely(++first == 1))
01078                                 continue;
01079 
01080                         fid_le_to_cpu(&fid, &ent->lde_fid);
01081 
01082                         /* wait for spare statahead window */
01083                         do {
01084                                 l_wait_event(sa_thread->t_ctl_waitq,
01085                                              !sa_sent_full(sai) ||
01086                                              sa_has_callback(sai) ||
01087                                              !agl_list_empty(sai) ||
01088                                              !thread_is_running(sa_thread),
01089                                              &lwi);
01090 
01091                                 sa_handle_callback(sai);
01092 
01093                                 spin_lock(&lli->lli_agl_lock);
01094                                 while (sa_sent_full(sai) &&
01095                                        !agl_list_empty(sai)) {
01096                                         struct ll_inode_info *clli;
01097 
01098                                         clli = agl_first_entry(sai);
01099                                         list_del_init(&clli->lli_agl_list);
01100                                         spin_unlock(&lli->lli_agl_lock);
01101 
01102                                         ll_agl_trigger(&clli->lli_vfs_inode,
01103                                                         sai);
01104 
01105                                         spin_lock(&lli->lli_agl_lock);
01106                                 }
01107                                 spin_unlock(&lli->lli_agl_lock);
01108                         } while (sa_sent_full(sai) &&
01109                                  thread_is_running(sa_thread));
01110 
01111                         sa_statahead(parent, name, namelen, &fid);
01112                 }
01113 
01114                 pos = le64_to_cpu(dp->ldp_hash_end);
01115                 ll_release_page(dir, page,
01116                                 le32_to_cpu(dp->ldp_flags) & LDF_COLLIDE);
01117 
01118                 if (sa_low_hit(sai)) {
01119                         rc = -EFAULT;
01120                         atomic_inc(&sbi->ll_sa_wrong);
01121                         CDEBUG(D_READA, "Statahead for dir "DFID" hit "
01122                                "ratio too low: hit/miss "LPU64"/"LPU64
01123                                ", sent/replied "LPU64"/"LPU64", stopping "
01124                                "statahead thread: pid %d\n",
01125                                PFID(&lli->lli_fid), sai->sai_hit,
01126                                sai->sai_miss, sai->sai_sent,
01127                                sai->sai_replied, current_pid());
01128                         break;
01129                 }
01130         }
01131         ll_dir_chain_fini(&chain);
01132         ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
01133 
01134         if (rc < 0) {
01135                 spin_lock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01136                 thread_set_flags(sa_thread, SVC_STOPPING);
01137                 lli->lli_sa_enabled = 0;
01138                 spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01139         }
01140 
01141         /* statahead is finished, but statahead entries need to be cached, wait
01142          * for file release to stop me. */
01143         while (thread_is_running(sa_thread)) {
01144                 l_wait_event(sa_thread->t_ctl_waitq,
01145                              sa_has_callback(sai) ||
01146                              !thread_is_running(sa_thread),
01147                              &lwi);
01148 
01149                 sa_handle_callback(sai);
01150         }
01151 
01152         EXIT;
01153 out:
01154         if (sai->sai_agl_valid) {
01155                 spin_lock(&lli->lli_agl_lock);
01156                 thread_set_flags(agl_thread, SVC_STOPPING);
01157                 spin_unlock(&lli->lli_agl_lock);
01158                 wake_up(&agl_thread->t_ctl_waitq);
01159 
01160                 CDEBUG(D_READA, "stop agl thread: sai %p pid %u\n",
01161                        sai, (unsigned int)agl_thread->t_pid);
01162                 l_wait_event(agl_thread->t_ctl_waitq,
01163                              thread_is_stopped(agl_thread),
01164                              &lwi);
01165         } else {
01166                 /* Set agl_thread flags anyway. */
01167                 thread_set_flags(agl_thread, SVC_STOPPED);
01168         }
01169 
01170         /* wait for inflight statahead RPCs to finish, and then we can free sai
01171          * safely because statahead RPC will access sai data */
01172         while (sai->sai_sent != sai->sai_replied) {
01173                 /* in case we're not woken up, timeout wait */
01174                 lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC >> 3),
01175                                   NULL, NULL);
01176                 l_wait_event(sa_thread->t_ctl_waitq,
01177                         sai->sai_sent == sai->sai_replied, &lwi);
01178         }
01179 
01180         /* release resources held by statahead RPCs */
01181         sa_handle_callback(sai);
01182 
01183         spin_lock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01184         thread_set_flags(sa_thread, SVC_STOPPED);
01185         spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01186 
01187         CDEBUG(D_READA, "statahead thread stopped: sai %p, parent %.*s\n",
01188                sai, parent->d_name.len, parent->d_name.name);
01189 
01190         wake_up(&sai->sai_waitq);
01191         wake_up(&sa_thread->t_ctl_waitq);
01192         ll_sai_put(sai);
01193 
01194         return rc;
01195 }
01196 
01197 /* authorize opened dir handle @key to statahead */
01198 void ll_authorize_statahead(struct inode *dir, void *key)
01199 {
01200         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(dir);
01201 
01202         spin_lock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01203         if (lli->lli_opendir_key == NULL && lli->lli_sai == NULL) {
01204                 /*
01205                  * if lli_sai is not NULL, it means previous statahead is not
01206                  * finished yet, we'd better not start a new statahead for now.
01207                  */
01208                 LASSERT(lli->lli_opendir_pid == 0);
01209                 lli->lli_opendir_key = key;
01210                 lli->lli_opendir_pid = current_pid();
01211                 lli->lli_sa_enabled = 1;
01212         }
01213         spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01214 }
01215 
01216 /*
01217  * deauthorize opened dir handle @key to statahead, and notify statahead thread
01218  * to quit if it's running.
01219  */
01220 void ll_deauthorize_statahead(struct inode *dir, void *key)
01221 {
01222         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(dir);
01223         struct ll_statahead_info *sai;
01224 
01225         LASSERT(lli->lli_opendir_key == key);
01226         LASSERT(lli->lli_opendir_pid != 0);
01227 
01228         CDEBUG(D_READA, "deauthorize statahead for "DFID"\n",
01229                 PFID(&lli->lli_fid));
01230 
01231         spin_lock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01232         lli->lli_opendir_key = NULL;
01233         lli->lli_opendir_pid = 0;
01234         lli->lli_sa_enabled = 0;
01235         sai = lli->lli_sai;
01236         if (sai != NULL && thread_is_running(&sai->sai_thread)) {
01237                 /*
01238                  * statahead thread may not quit yet because it needs to cache
01239                  * entries, now it's time to tell it to quit.
01240                  */
01241                 thread_set_flags(&sai->sai_thread, SVC_STOPPING);
01242                 wake_up(&sai->sai_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
01243         }
01244         spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01245 }
01246 
01247 enum {
01251         LS_NOT_FIRST_DE = 0,
01255         LS_FIRST_DE,
01259         LS_FIRST_DOT_DE
01260 };
01261 
01262 /* file is first dirent under @dir */
01263 static int is_first_dirent(struct inode *dir, struct dentry *dentry)
01264 {
01265         struct ll_dir_chain   chain;
01266         struct qstr          *target = &dentry->d_name;
01267         struct md_op_data    *op_data;
01268         int                   dot_de;
01269         struct page          *page = NULL;
01270         int                   rc = LS_NOT_FIRST_DE;
01271         __u64                 pos = 0;
01272         ENTRY;
01273 
01274         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, dir, dir, NULL, 0, 0,
01275                                      LUSTRE_OPC_ANY, dir);
01276         if (IS_ERR(op_data))
01277                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(op_data));
01281         op_data->op_max_pages = ll_i2sbi(dir)->ll_md_brw_pages;
01282 
01283         ll_dir_chain_init(&chain);
01284         page = ll_get_dir_page(dir, op_data, 0, &chain);
01285 
01286         while (1) {
01287                 struct lu_dirpage *dp;
01288                 struct lu_dirent  *ent;
01289 
01290                 if (IS_ERR(page)) {
01291                         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(dir);
01292 
01293                         rc = PTR_ERR(page);
01294                         CERROR("%s: reading dir "DFID" at "LPU64
01295                                "opendir_pid = %u : rc = %d\n",
01296                                ll_get_fsname(dir->i_sb, NULL, 0),
01297                                PFID(ll_inode2fid(dir)), pos,
01298                                lli->lli_opendir_pid, rc);
01299                         break;
01300                 }
01301 
01302                 dp = page_address(page);
01303                 for (ent = lu_dirent_start(dp); ent != NULL;
01304                      ent = lu_dirent_next(ent)) {
01305                         __u64 hash;
01306                         int namelen;
01307                         char *name;
01308 
01309                         hash = le64_to_cpu(ent->lde_hash);
01310                         /* The ll_get_dir_page() can return any page containing
01311                          * the given hash which may be not the start hash. */
01312                         if (unlikely(hash < pos))
01313                                 continue;
01314 
01315                         namelen = le16_to_cpu(ent->lde_namelen);
01316                         if (unlikely(namelen == 0))
01317                                 /*
01318                                  * skip dummy record.
01319                                  */
01320                                 continue;
01321 
01322                         name = ent->lde_name;
01323                         if (name[0] == '.') {
01324                                 if (namelen == 1)
01325                                         /*
01326                                          * skip "."
01327                                          */
01328                                         continue;
01329                                 else if (name[1] == '.' && namelen == 2)
01330                                         /*
01331                                          * skip ".."
01332                                          */
01333                                         continue;
01334                                 else
01335                                         dot_de = 1;
01336                         } else {
01337                                 dot_de = 0;
01338                         }
01339 
01340                         if (dot_de && target->name[0] != '.') {
01341                                 CDEBUG(D_READA, "%.*s skip hidden file %.*s\n",
01342                                        target->len, target->name,
01343                                        namelen, name);
01344                                 continue;
01345                         }
01346 
01347                         if (target->len != namelen ||
01348                             memcmp(target->name, name, namelen) != 0)
01349                                 rc = LS_NOT_FIRST_DE;
01350                         else if (!dot_de)
01351                                 rc = LS_FIRST_DE;
01352                         else
01353                                 rc = LS_FIRST_DOT_DE;
01354 
01355                         ll_release_page(dir, page, false);
01356                         GOTO(out, rc);
01357                 }
01358                 pos = le64_to_cpu(dp->ldp_hash_end);
01359                 if (pos == MDS_DIR_END_OFF) {
01360                         /*
01361                          * End of directory reached.
01362                          */
01363                         ll_release_page(dir, page, false);
01364                         GOTO(out, rc);
01365                 } else {
01366                         /*
01367                          * chain is exhausted
01368                          * Normal case: continue to the next page.
01369                          */
01370                         ll_release_page(dir, page, le32_to_cpu(dp->ldp_flags) &
01371                                               LDF_COLLIDE);
01372                         page = ll_get_dir_page(dir, op_data, pos, &chain);
01373                 }
01374         }
01375         EXIT;
01376 out:
01377         ll_dir_chain_fini(&chain);
01378         ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
01379         return rc;
01380 }
01381 
01394 static int revalidate_statahead_dentry(struct inode *dir,
01395                                         struct ll_statahead_info *sai,
01396                                         struct dentry **dentryp,
01397                                         bool unplug)
01398 {
01399         struct sa_entry *entry = NULL;
01400         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
01401         struct ll_dentry_data *ldd;
01402         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(dir);
01403         int rc = 0;
01404         ENTRY;
01405 
01406         if ((*dentryp)->d_name.name[0] == '.') {
01407                 if (sai->sai_ls_all ||
01408                     sai->sai_miss_hidden >= sai->sai_skip_hidden) {
01409                         /*
01410                          * Hidden dentry is the first one, or statahead
01411                          * thread does not skip so many hidden dentries
01412                          * before "sai_ls_all" enabled as below.
01413                          */
01414                 } else {
01415                         if (!sai->sai_ls_all)
01416                                 /*
01417                                  * It maybe because hidden dentry is not
01418                                  * the first one, "sai_ls_all" was not
01419                                  * set, then "ls -al" missed. Enable
01420                                  * "sai_ls_all" for such case.
01421                                  */
01422                                 sai->sai_ls_all = 1;
01423 
01424                         /*
01425                          * Such "getattr" has been skipped before
01426                          * "sai_ls_all" enabled as above.
01427                          */
01428                         sai->sai_miss_hidden++;
01429                         RETURN(-EAGAIN);
01430                 }
01431         }
01432 
01433         if (unplug)
01434                 GOTO(out, rc = 1);
01435 
01436         entry = sa_get(sai, &(*dentryp)->d_name);
01437         if (entry == NULL)
01438                 GOTO(out, rc = -EAGAIN);
01439 
01440         /* if statahead is busy in readdir, help it do post-work */
01441         if (!sa_ready(entry) && sai->sai_in_readpage)
01442                 sa_handle_callback(sai);
01443 
01444         if (!sa_ready(entry)) {
01445                 spin_lock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01446                 sai->sai_index_wait = entry->se_index;
01447                 spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01448                 lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT_INTR(cfs_time_seconds(30), NULL,
01449                                        LWI_ON_SIGNAL_NOOP, NULL);
01450                 rc = l_wait_event(sai->sai_waitq, sa_ready(entry), &lwi);
01451                 if (rc < 0) {
01452                         /*
01453                          * entry may not be ready, so it may be used by inflight
01454                          * statahead RPC, don't free it.
01455                          */
01456                         entry = NULL;
01457                         GOTO(out, rc = -EAGAIN);
01458                 }
01459         }
01460 
01461         if (entry->se_state == SA_ENTRY_SUCC && entry->se_inode != NULL) {
01462                 struct inode *inode = entry->se_inode;
01463                 struct lookup_intent it = { .it_op = IT_GETATTR,
01464                                             .it_lock_handle =
01465                                                 entry->se_handle };
01466                 __u64 bits;
01467 
01468                 rc = md_revalidate_lock(ll_i2mdexp(dir), &it,
01469                                         ll_inode2fid(inode), &bits);
01470                 if (rc == 1) {
01471                         if ((*dentryp)->d_inode == NULL) {
01472                                 struct dentry *alias;
01473 
01474                                 alias = ll_splice_alias(inode, *dentryp);
01475                                 if (IS_ERR(alias)) {
01476                                         ll_intent_release(&it);
01477                                         GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(alias));
01478                                 }
01479                                 *dentryp = alias;
01480                                 /* statahead prepared this inode, transfer inode
01481                                  * refcount from sa_entry to dentry */
01482                                 entry->se_inode = NULL;
01483                         } else if ((*dentryp)->d_inode != inode) {
01484                                 /* revalidate, but inode is recreated */
01485                                 CDEBUG(D_READA,
01486                                         "%s: stale dentry %.*s inode "
01487                                         DFID", statahead inode "DFID
01488                                         "\n",
01489                                         ll_get_fsname((*dentryp)->d_inode->i_sb,
01490                                                       NULL, 0),
01491                                         (*dentryp)->d_name.len,
01492                                         (*dentryp)->d_name.name,
01493                                         PFID(ll_inode2fid((*dentryp)->d_inode)),
01494                                         PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)));
01495                                 ll_intent_release(&it);
01496                                 GOTO(out, rc = -ESTALE);
01497                         }
01498 
01499                         if ((bits & MDS_INODELOCK_LOOKUP) &&
01500                             d_lustre_invalid(*dentryp))
01501                                 d_lustre_revalidate(*dentryp);
01502                         ll_intent_release(&it);
01503                 }
01504         }
01505 out:
01506         /*
01507          * statahead cached sa_entry can be used only once, and will be killed
01508          * right after use, so if lookup/revalidate accessed statahead cache,
01509          * set dentry ldd_sa_generation to parent lli_sa_generation, later if we
01510          * stat this file again, we know we've done statahead before, see
01511          * dentry_may_statahead().
01512          */
01513         ldd = ll_d2d(*dentryp);
01514         /* ldd can be NULL if llite lookup failed. */
01515         if (ldd != NULL)
01516                 ldd->lld_sa_generation = lli->lli_sa_generation;
01517         sa_put(sai, entry);
01518 
01519         RETURN(rc);
01520 }
01521 
01534 static int start_statahead_thread(struct inode *dir, struct dentry *dentry)
01535 {
01536         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(dir);
01537         struct ll_statahead_info *sai = NULL;
01538         struct dentry *parent = dentry->d_parent;
01539         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread;
01540         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
01541         struct task_struct *task;
01542         int rc;
01543         ENTRY;
01544 
01545         /* I am the "lli_opendir_pid" owner, only me can set "lli_sai". */
01546         rc = is_first_dirent(dir, dentry);
01547         if (rc == LS_NOT_FIRST_DE)
01548                 /* It is not "ls -{a}l" operation, no need statahead for it. */
01549                 GOTO(out, rc = -EFAULT);
01550 
01551         sai = ll_sai_alloc(parent);
01552         if (sai == NULL)
01553                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01554 
01555         sai->sai_ls_all = (rc == LS_FIRST_DOT_DE);
01556 
01557         /* if current lli_opendir_key was deauthorized, or dir re-opened by
01558          * another process, don't start statahead, otherwise the newly spawned
01559          * statahead thread won't be notified to quit. */
01560         spin_lock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01561         if (unlikely(lli->lli_sai != NULL ||
01562                      lli->lli_opendir_key == NULL ||
01563                      lli->lli_opendir_pid != current->pid)) {
01564                 spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01565                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPERM);
01566         }
01567         lli->lli_sai = sai;
01568         spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01569 
01570         atomic_inc(&ll_i2sbi(parent->d_inode)->ll_sa_running);
01571 
01572         CDEBUG(D_READA, "start statahead thread: [pid %d] [parent %.*s]\n",
01573                current_pid(), parent->d_name.len, parent->d_name.name);
01574 
01575         task = kthread_run(ll_statahead_thread, parent, "ll_sa_%u",
01576                            lli->lli_opendir_pid);
01577         thread = &sai->sai_thread;
01578         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
01579                 rc = PTR_ERR(task);
01580                 CERROR("can't start ll_sa thread, rc: %d\n", rc);
01581                 GOTO(out, rc);
01582         }
01583 
01584         l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
01585                      thread_is_running(thread) || thread_is_stopped(thread),
01586                      &lwi);
01587         ll_sai_put(sai);
01588 
01589         /*
01590          * We don't stat-ahead for the first dirent since we are already in
01591          * lookup.
01592          */
01593         RETURN(-EAGAIN);
01594 
01595 out:
01596         /* once we start statahead thread failed, disable statahead so that
01597          * subsequent stat won't waste time to try it. */
01598         spin_lock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01599         lli->lli_sa_enabled = 0;
01600         lli->lli_sai = NULL;
01601         spin_unlock(&lli->lli_sa_lock);
01602 
01603         if (sai != NULL)
01604                 ll_sai_free(sai);
01605 
01606         RETURN(rc);
01607 }
01608 
01624 int ll_statahead(struct inode *dir, struct dentry **dentryp, bool unplug)
01625 {
01626         struct ll_statahead_info *sai;
01627 
01628         sai = ll_sai_get(dir);
01629         if (sai != NULL) {
01630                 int rc;
01631 
01632                 rc = revalidate_statahead_dentry(dir, sai, dentryp, unplug);
01633                 CDEBUG(D_READA, "revalidate statahead %.*s: %d.\n",
01634                         (*dentryp)->d_name.len, (*dentryp)->d_name.name, rc);
01635                 ll_sai_put(sai);
01636                 return rc;
01637         }
01638         return start_statahead_thread(dir, *dentryp);
01639 }
